org.usfirst.frc.team5957.robot.subsystems

Class DriveTrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
      • org.usfirst.frc.team5957.robot.subsystems.DriveTrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.NamedSendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable

    public class DriveTrain
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
    This subsystem contains the motors used to drive the robot.
    See Also:
    Subsystem

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes the robot's drive motors. Call in Robot.robotInit().

      • brake

        public void brake()
        This method stops the robot from moving.

      • drive

        public void drive(double power,
                  double turn)
        Drives the robot like RobotDrive.drive()
        Parameters:
        power - The speed setting for the outside wheel in a turn, forward or backwards, +1 to -1.
        turn - The rate of turn, constant for different forward speeds. Set curve < 0 for left turn or curve > 0 for right turn. Set curve = e^(-r/w) to get a turn radius r for wheelbase w of your robot. Conversely, turn radius r = -ln(curve)*w for a given value of curve and wheelbase w.

      • tankDrive

        public void tankDrive(double leftPow,
                      double rightPow)
        Implements a tank drive system for the robot. Can be used the vertical values from two joysticks.
        Parameters:
        leftPow - The speed setting for the left side of the drive train, +1 to -1. (Negative is forward, as with a joystick's Y axis)
        rightPow - The speed setting for the right side of the drive train, +1 to -1. (Negative is forward, as with a joystick's Y axis)
        See Also:
        RobotDrive.tankDrive(double, double)

      • arcadeDrive

        public void arcadeDrive(double moveValue,
                        double rotateValue)
        Implements an arcade drive. Can be used with a the horizontal and vertical values from a single joystick.
        Parameters:
        moveValue - The value to be used for forwards/backwards, +1 to -1. (Negative is forward, as with a joystick's Y axis)
        rotateValue - The value to be used for right/left, +1 to -1.
        See Also:
        RobotDrive.arcadeDrive(double, double)

      • initDefaultCommand

        public void initDefaultCommand()
        Specified by:
        initDefaultCommand in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
